data.title: Very good espresso
data.text:
Great blend and serving Verve coffee, the setup is unassuming and blasting obscure music, almost to the point that it should attract a certain amount of eccentricity, which all die hard coffee drinkers are anyway  

Espresso eating a very solid 7/10

data.title: Where's the coffee?
data.text: I ordered a latte without any of the sweetners... just milk.  The coffee flavor was non-existent.  To get the coffee taste you may need to ask for a double shot.  The rock music was a little loud at 8:30 am.  I think they're looking for younger customers.

data.title: Searching for a unique cup of joe
data.text: After a day excursion up the San Gabriel mtns. I searched on my phone for a near by coffee house. This cute up and coming coffee house showed up in my search and it seemed like an interesting stop to make. The owners I met had much passion and drive to make a great coffee house. The coffee was good, the atmosphere was casual and welcoming. The coffee slips are cool.. just like this hse.

data.title: Decent coffe
data.text: The vibe of this place is either punk or heavy metal, lots of stickers on the wall, loud screaming music ( while I was there) and it's not my kind of place I'd go for a relaxing cup of coffee.  I had a vanilla lavender latte.  The coffee was a bit weak, not as rich as I prefer.  The vanilla and Lavender flavor was nice but the coffee part tasted watery.  Friendly service.   I would try them again if I was in the area-for take out only though!

data.title: These punks know what they're doing
data.text: Very cool atmosphere, but the best part of Rad Coffee is the staff that are constantly innovating and coming up with genuinely delicious ideas for drinks and baked goods.

data.title: Rad.
data.text: The single best iced coffee that I have ever had. The vibe is awesome. A few more comfy chairs would be welcome but a solid place for a GREAT cup of coffee. Keep up the awesome shop!

data.title: Brand-new, just starting, good coffee
data.text:
This is a Brand new place, appearing in their own storefront after having been run from a juice bar. It looked new, just starting, stripped down to the basics.

As I was not sure how to order my usual, I asked for and got a good cappucino. Very tasty.  I liked the place because of this AND the fact that they were giving it a go at running their own store.  

Very nice, friendly service, good coffee. Asked for and was given half-and-half for my coffee. I use a slug to cool the coffee off; purists might argue that this turned my drink into a latte, but, geeze, I don't use that much.  The cappucino was still rich with coffee. 

As I said above, it is new, so it is still pretty bare-bones coffee-machine-wise, furnishing-wise and decor wise. I will visit again and I hope they are able to stay in business.  Downtown Upland needs a good coffee joint.

Good Luck to Rad Coffee! Lots of people need to visit so they will be able to stay!
